It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plants are typically low-growing shrubs or herbs with succulent stems and leaves adapted to withstand drought conditions. Oreobliton species produce small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color. These plants are of interest in botanical studies due to their unique adaptations to harsh environments and their potential ecological roles in desert ecosystems.
